intro: Diplotaxis griquensis, commonly known as the Grootfontein dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It produces a capsule fruit containing numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Diplotaxis griquensis is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine.
